20110118172011.000|20110118172014.000|TR0|visit with President Obama?  Well, here's 
20110118172014.000|20110118172016.000|TR0|why.
20110118172016.000|20110118172019.000|TR0|
20110118172019.000|20110118172022.000|TR0|China has the second largest economy in 
20110118172022.000|20110118172024.000|TR0|the world and the fastest growing.  Some 
20110118172024.000|20110118172027.000|TR0|economists say China could surpass the 
20110118172027.000|20110118172029.000|TR0|U.S. by 2025. The country has the largest 
20110118172029.000|20110118172032.000|TR0|population in the world, at 1.3 billion 
20110118172032.000|20110118172034.000|TR0|people, and it has a rapidly emerging 
20110118172034.000|20110118172037.000|TR0|middle class.
20110118172037.000|20110118172040.000|TR0|
20110118172040.000|20110118172042.000|TR0|The trade relationship between the United 
20110118172042.000|20110118172045.000|TR0|States and China is out of whack.  In 
20110118172045.000|20110118172047.000|TR0|2009, the U.S. spent $263 billion more 
20110118172047.000|20110118172050.000|TR0|buying Chinese exports than the Chinese 
20110118172050.000|20110118172052.000|TR0|bought U.S. exports.
20110118172052.000|20110118172055.000|TR0|
20110118172055.000|20110118172058.000|TR0|Still, some U.S. politicians hope China's 
20110118172058.000|20110118172100.000|TR0|economic uptick will benefit their own 
20110118172100.000|20110118172103.000|TR0|cash-strapped cities.
20110118172103.000|20110118172105.000|TR0|

20110118172134.000|20110118172136.000|TR0|here.

20110118172151.000|20110118172154.000|TR0|
20110118172154.000|20110118172157.000|TR0|BELL:  Well, if I am mayor, and I'm out 
20110118172157.000|20110118172159.000|TR0|recruiting inside the United States, and I

20110118172207.000|20110118172209.000|TR0|haven't helped the national economy.  I

20110118172215.000|20110118172217.000|TR0|it somewhere else.  And so my philosophy 
20110118172217.000|20110118172220.000|TR0|is that we needed to be able to go out and

20110118172253.000|20110118172256.000|TR0|BELL:  Well, for one, the first portion of 
20110118172256.000|20110118172258.000|TR0|this is just to be able to establish a 
20110118172258.000|20110118172301.000|TR0|relationship, and we've done that.  We've 
20110118172301.000|20110118172303.000|TR0|had probably about four to five 
20110118172303.000|20110118172306.000|TR0|delegations since our September visit come 
20110118172306.000|20110118172309.000|TR0|to Toledo and northwest Ohio, and they've

20110118172311.000|20110118172314.000|TR0|seeing a portion of the United States that 
20110118172314.000|20110118172316.000|TR0|they had really actually never heard of 
20110118172316.000|20110118172319.000|TR0|until we went over there.  But what we 
20110118172319.000|20110118172321.000|TR0|hoped to gain through that is to actually 
20110118172321.000|20110118172324.000|TR0|have them invest in our city, invest in
